common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the Pieces desktop app, primarily on Windows, including large markdown blocks in Copilot responses making scrolling difficult, inability to collapse code blocks, and problems with the Pieces sidebar.  Additionally, some users report issues with Pro settings not applying despite being logged in. Troubleshooting steps may include checking for Pieces OS updates, clearing cache, and reinstalling the app.

common_issues.title: Pieces connectivity and installation issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty installing and connecting Pieces extensions and applications across VS Code, web browsers, and desktop. Issues include the VS Code extension repeatedly requesting installation without success, browser extensions failing to connect to Pieces OS, and the Pieces sidebar not saving error logs or reflecting Pro account upgrades.  Users have tried reinstalling dependencies, checking VPN settings, and ensuring Pieces OS is running, but the problems persist.

related_issues.title: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
related_issues.text: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues across multiple platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting Pieces extensions and plugins (Obsidian, Chrome, Edge) to Pieces OS.  Problems include undetected ports, failed logins, and pro features not activating. This affects Windows users, some using VPNs.  Check Pieces OS version, port settings (default changed to 39300), ensure login credentials are correct, and verify VPN/firewall configurations.

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
related_issues.text:
Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS Version: 12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I installed Obsidian and added the Pieces extension. The chat works ok, but within Obsidian when I highlight text and right click to send to Pieces it fails. Checking inside Obsidian the Pieces setup it says Pieces port not detected, and does not allow me to set port for Pieces OS within Obsidian.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the Pieces desktop application, including unintended selection behavior (potentially related to stuck shift/mouse click), inability to collapse code blocks, and sidebar issues such as error logs not saving and pro settings not applying despite being logged in.  These issues span different Pieces OS versions (12.2.1, 12.2.2) and Desktop versions (4.3.1, 4.3.4).

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with backup restoration, dependency installation, and sidebar functionality in the Pieces OS desktop and web extension. Backup restoration fails midway, dependency installation gets stuck on "Retry Step", and the sidebar has display issues and pro account features are unavailable despite being logged in.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions.

related_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Pieces OS, Desktop Application

* Operating System / Platform: Linux

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1





After installation, the “Initialize Desktop App” step has run successfully. The “Ensure core dependencies” step displays the message “Retry Step”.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving sidebar issues: Focus on fixing the problems with the Pieces sidebar, including error log saving, Pro settings application, and display inconsistencies.  These issues impact multiple users across different platforms and affect core functionality.

Investigate and address Pieces OS connectivity problems:  The recurring problems with extensions and plugins connecting to Pieces OS require immediate attention.  This includes checking port settings, login functionality, and VPN/firewall compatibility.

Improve Pieces Desktop application stability: Address the reported bugs related to unintended selection behavior, code block collapsing, and large markdown blocks in Copilot responses.  These issues negatively impact user experience.

Provide clear communication and documentation: Update documentation and support resources to address common issues like port changes, VPN configurations, and troubleshooting steps for connection problems.  Proactively communicate these changes to users.
Enhance backup and restore functionality: Investigate and fix the reported backup restoration failures to ensure data integrity and user confidence in the backup process.

Improve VS Code extension installation: Address the issue of the VS Code extension repeatedly requesting installation without success.  This blocks users from accessing Pieces functionality within VS Code.
Monitor and address Pieces OS resource usage: Investigate reports of high RAM/CPU usage by Pieces OS to optimize performance and prevent negative user experiences.
